Ad Text:
Help us deliver a better tomorrow

Australia Post is delivering for all Australians. From the vehicles we drive to the small businesses that make our communities thrive, we’re delivering for the environment, for our communities, for our customers and for our people. We’re moving forward—and we want you to come along for the ride.

About the opportunity

You will report to the Senior Manager – Network Modelling & Optimisation, in this role you will develop, maintain, and enhance cost models used for network planning, budgeting, and financial forecasting. You’ll work closely with network planning, engineering, and finance teams to provide insights that drive strategic decision-making and optimise network investment.

This is a hands-on, analytical role for someone who enjoys solving complex problems, interrogating data, and building models that shape the future of our logistics network. You’ll be comfortable working with messy, conflicting data, and have the initiative to go out and get the information you need from across the business.

What you’ll deliver with us

Build and maintain network cost models using Excel and other data tools.
Gather, clean, and analyse quantitative cost data (e.g., transport costs, machine outputs, resource allocation) to support operational and financial decision-making.
Conduct scenario analyses to evaluate the financial implications of network strategies and investment options.
Prepare and present detailed reports on network costs and financial performance to senior management and stakeholders.
Collaborate with a broad range of stakeholders, including network development, finance, digital/data teams, and external partners as required.
Document and communicate logical supply chain scenarios for review and implementation.
Lead and embed a culture of continuous improvement, safety, and customer focus across the function.

About you

You’re a go-getter who brings energy, adaptability, and a keen analytical mind to every challenge. You’re financially literate, comfortable with economic drivers, and able to build and interrogate models that deliver actionable insights—even when the data isn’t perfect.

You will also have:

Experience in finance, operations research, or modelling roles (ideally 3+ years), covering cost estimating, cost-to-serve, activity-based costing, and cost reconciliations.
Ability to build baseline and future cost models, reconcile data, and validate assumptions.
Proficiency in data analysis tools (Excel, SQL, Python, R, PowerBI).
Aptitude for learning and applying new tools and techniques.
Strong stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to work across teams and influence outcomes.
A passion for learning, problem-solving, and continuous improvement.
Desirable: Tertiary qualification in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics, Financial Modelling, or a related field.

How we’ll deliver for you

At Australia Post, we’re proud to be a trusted, inclusive, and forward-thinking organisation that reflects the communities we serve. Joining our team means being part of a culture built on our core values—Trust, Inclusivity, Empowerment, and Safety—our TIES that bind us together.

Join an iconic Australian brand and leading logistics organisation with over 200 years of trusted service.
Excellent career development and long-term growth opportunities.
Drive programs that have a national influence and meaningful impact.
Take advantage of employee perks, including discounts on products and services, and wellness support.
Contribute to a team that delivers essential services to communities across Australia.

We’re delivering together

Australia Post acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of the land on which we operate, live and gather as employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for people from all walks of life and encourage applications from people of all ages, genders and backgrounds—including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, People with Disability, LGBTQIA+ and Refugees.




We are one of the largest organisations in Australia to successfully achieve Disability Confident Recruiter status. If you have any questions about accessibility, please contact our Diversity & Inclusion team at inclusivecareers@auspost.com.au

Help us deliver a better tomorrow

Australia Post is delivering for all Australians. From the vehicles we drive to the small businesses that make our communities thrive, we’re delivering for the environment, for our communities, for our customers and for our people. We’re moving forward—and we want you to come along for the ride.

 

About the opportunity

You will report to the Senior Manager – Network Modelling & Optimisation, this role will play a pivotal part in shaping the future of our logistics network. You’ll not only build and analyse complex cost models but also apply advanced optimisation tools and techniques to deliver actionable solutions that drive efficiency and value across our operations.

 

This is a hands-on, high-impact role for someone who thrives on solving complex, ambiguous problems, and is comfortable working with large, messy datasets. You’ll collaborate with stakeholders across the business, interrogate data, and use your insights to influence strategic decisions at scale.

 

What you’ll deliver with us

Build, maintain, and enhance advanced network cost models using Excel, Python, R, PowerBI, and specialist optimisation software.
Apply and use optimisation tools and techniques to identify, prioritise, and implement cost-saving solutions.
Conduct scenario analyses and use geo-spatial data to inform network design and investment decisions.
Gather, clean, and analyse quantitative cost data (e.g., transport costs, machine outputs, resource allocation) to support operational and financial decision-making.
Present detailed reports and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders.
Collaborate with a broad range of stakeholders, including network development, finance, digital/data teams, and external partners.
Lead and embed a culture of continuous improvement, safety, and customer focus across the function.

 

About you

You’re an energetic, adaptable problem-solver with a passion for optimisation and a knack for turning data into actionable insights. You’re financially literate, comfortable with economic drivers, and able to build and interrogate models that deliver real-world impact—even when the data isn’t perfect.

 

You will also have:

Significant experience in finance, operations research, or modelling roles (ideally 7+ years), covering cost estimating, cost-to-serve, activity-based costing, and cost reconciliations.
Proven ability to build and optimise complex cost models, reconcile data, and validate assumptions.
Advanced proficiency in data analysis tools (Excel, SQL, Python, R, PowerBI) and network optimisation modelling software (e.g., Coupa, Blue Yonder, AIMMS, AnyLogic, etc.).
Experience applying optimisation techniques and using insights to drive solutions, including geo-spatial analysis.
Strong stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to work across teams and influence outcomes.
A passion for learning, problem-solving, and continuous improvement.
Desirable: Tertiary qualification in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics, Financial Modelling, or a related field. PhD-level qualifications highly regarded.

 

How we’ll deliver for you

At Australia Post, we’re proud to be a trusted, inclusive, and forward-thinking organisation that reflects the communities we serve. Joining our team means being part of a culture built on our core values—Trust, Inclusivity, Empowerment, and Safety—our TIES that bind us together.

Join an iconic Australian brand and leading logistics organisation with over 200 years of trusted service.
Excellent career development and long-term growth opportunities.
Drive programs that have a national influence and meaningful impact.
Take advantage of employee perks, including discounts on products and services, and wellness support.
Contribute to a team that delivers essential services to communities across Australia.

 

We’re delivering together

We are one of the largest organisations in Australia to successfully achieve Disability Confident Recruiter status. If you have any questions about accessibility, please contact our Diversity & Inclusion team at inclusivecareers@auspost.com.au.
